title: Sans-serif – Possibly a custom
content:
Hello type wizards!

Does anyone recognize the attached sample’s name. It appeared in Julia.uk.com’s project for the Arika film festival. I’ve often admired it from afar, and decided to have a closer look at it. I know they’ve produced custom faces in the past, so I wouldn’t be at all surprised if this was custom too. I feel like I’ve seen it elsewhere though… or something very similar. If you have any suggestions, I would be most grateful.

Thanks in advance.  
Gordon

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20140828224642im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Arika_5458.png)
author: GordonBeveridge

comments.content:
I'm afraid this should be (as almost everything coming from julia Valerio Di Lucente, Erwan Lhuissier and Hugo Timm). To me, it looks they tried to manually round [Century Gothic](http://web.archive.org/web/20140828224642/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/mti/century-gothic/) plus a relative clumsiness/naive feeling.  
Some I like: [Simplo Soft](http://web.archive.org/web/20140828224642/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/durotype/simplo-soft), [Air Factory Rounded](http://web.archive.org/web/20140828224642/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/khaito-gengo/air-factory-rounded), [Haymer](http://web.archive.org/web/20140828224642/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/gatf/haymer), [Ano](http://web.archive.org/web/20140828224642/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/alias/ano), [Brandon Grotesque](http://web.archive.org/web/20140828224642/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/hvdfonts/brandon-grotesque), [Reader](http://web.archive.org/web/20140828224642/http:/www.colophon-foundry.org/fonts/reader/about-font), [Raisonné](http://web.archive.org/web/20140828224642/http:/www.colophon-foundry.org/fonts/raisonne/about-font), [Fugue](http://web.archive.org/web/20140828224642/http:/www.radimpesko.com/fonts/fugue), [Ebisu](http://web.archive.org/web/20140828224642/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/thinkdust/ebisu), [Florence Sans](http://web.archive.org/web/20140828224642/http:/www.dafont.com/florencesans.font), [Buttacup](http://web.archive.org/web/20140828224642/http:/www.dafont.com/buttacup.font), [Dogrowskaz](http://web.archive.org/web/20140828224642/http:/www.typophile.com/node/80869), [Basetica](http://web.archive.org/web/20140828224642/http:/openswitzerland.org/), [Simon Sans](http://web.archive.org/web/20140828224642/http:/www.tendollarfonts.com/simon-sans-typeface), [Leberkaas Grotesk](http://web.archive.org/web/20140828224642/http:/www.tendollarfonts.com/leberkaas-grotesk-typeface), [FF Super Grotesk](http://web.archive.org/web/20140828224642/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/fontfont/ff-supergrotesk), [Drescher Grotesk](http://web.archive.org/web/20140828224642/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/bitstream/drescher-grotesk-bt)

Ryuk,  
Thought that might be the case. Thanks, though, for your host of suggestions. Already familiar with a few of them, but a few newbies to add to the wishlist if the chance arises. I’m convinced I’m gonna invest in Brandon Grotesque one of these days, and get my money’s worth within weeks for it.

Thank you!  
Gordon
